    • Method Detail

      • executeAddRole

        public static void executeAddRole(String sql,
                  int id,
                  Role role,
                  RoleValueCollection roleValues,
                  boolean supportAutoGeneratedKeys,
                  String autoKeysQuery)
        Execute the add role thing. As the SQL statement to insert user and group roles are diferent, they cannot be manipuled with a 'generic' statement, and is for this reason that addRole method is marked abstract.
        The only job the addRole method should do is to get the correct SQL statement for each case - user or group - and the repass it to this method, who then do the job for us.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL statement to be executed.
        id - The ID do insert. May be user's or group's id, depending of the situation ( the caller )
        role - The role name to insert
        roleValues - A RoleValueCollection collection containing the role values to insert. If none is wanted, just pass null as argument.
        supportAutoGeneratedKeys - Set to true if Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS is supported by the Driver, or false if not.
        autoKeysQuery - String

      • loadRoles

        public static RoleCollection loadRoles(ResultSet rs)
        See PermissionControl#executeAddRole(String, int, String, RoleValueCollection) for explanation about this method. The working way is the same.
        Parameters:
        rs - The ResultSet containing the data to be fetched. This method does not free the resultset after it finished using it, so it's responsability of the caller to do such task.
        Returns:
        A RoleCollection collection with the roles processed.

        public static String groupIdAsString(int[] ids)
